title: With the Saints leading 20-7 at halftime, Donna Brazile wants the team to sign Colin Kaepernick until Drew Brees is back
text:
It’s halftime in the New Orleans Saints–Seattle Seahawks game as we write this post with New Orleans leading 20-7. Saints QB Teddy Bridgewater, who replaced starter Drew Brees who is recovering from hand surgery, is 10 of 14 for 87 yards and a touchdown. Not too shabby.

But this isn’t good enough for Saints fan Donna Brazile. She wants the team to sign Colin Kaepernick instead:

Sorry @Saints, but @Kaepernick7 is still available. We need someone who can get the job done while #CoolBrees recover. It’s past time the @NFL allow him to return to the game.#WomenLoveFootball — Donna Brazile (@donnabrazile) September 22, 2019

What is she even talking about?

Saints have one of the best backup quarterbacks in football. This is a nonsensical thought. https://t.co/EdcgemHofA — Brent Scher (@BrentScher) September 22, 2019

They even used a high draft pick to get him:

The Saints traded a 2nd round pick for Teddy Bridgewater, who used to be a great starter. This has nothing to do with politics. — Brent Scher (@BrentScher) September 22, 2019

She should really stick to her day job helping Dems lose elections, because she’s really good at that:

We could have three good back ups. I am just looking forward to seeing @Kaepernick7 back in the lineup. Shame on the @NFL for not allowing this talented man to play. My view. Love @Saints — Donna Brazile (@donnabrazile) September 22, 2019

The Saints will receive the kickoff at the start of the 2nd half and we’ll add an update at the end of the game:

Special teams, defense power #Saints to 20-7 halftime lead. Quick first half recap. And Saints get ball to start second half. https://t.co/J6ZdptcdAn — DougTatum (@DougTatum) September 22, 2019

And we’ll see what she has to say after the game:

#GeauxSaints Oh what a relief this is. Half time and the score is 20-7 (Saints vs Seahwks). Stir your red beans and rice. Get a few more cold beers and 🙏🏾. — Donna Brazile (@donnabrazile) September 22, 2019

***
description: "The Saints traded a 2nd round pick for Teddy Bridgewater, who used to be a great starter."
